Tags: variable-substitution python declaration class

VariableSubstitutionDeclaration (python class)

See also

math concept | python inclusion class | python sample

This section presents the VariableSubstitutionDeclaration python class.

This class models the declaration of the variable-substitution inference-rule in the target universe-of-discourse.

Punctilious users do not need to instanciate objects from this class. In effect, the UniverseOfDiscourse class exposes the variable_substitution property, and instanciation is automatic when the property is accessed for the first time.

class punctilious.VariableSubstitutionDeclaration(universe_of_discourse, echo=None)
compose_paragraph_proof(o)

Overrides the generic paragraph proof method.

Return type:

Generator[Composable, Composable, bool]

infer_formula(p, phi, t, echo=None, **kwargs)

This python method does not verify the validity of the arguments, applies the inference-rule algorithm, and returns a formula.

Note

Note the critical distinction between the infer_formula and the infer_formula_statement methods. The former does not verify the validity of the arguments, applies the inference-rule algorithm, and produces a formula that may be invalid . The later verifies the validity of the arguments, applies the inference-rule algorithm, and produces a formula-statement that is valid by definition.

verify_args(p, phi, t, echo=None, **kwargs)

Verify if the arguments comply syntactically with the inference-rule.
